title: Volunteer Interview

title: Technical Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process through Loma Linda, CA was a bit challenging and requires a lot of patience. I had applied over a month ago when I received my first round of interviews out of three. The first is the screening via phone. Afterwards, was a zoom meeting than in person.
Interview Questions: In a group of potential candidates, how would I narrow down to one?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Recieved a call and was interviewed the day after. Got a response regarding employment after 3 wks of interview since hiring manager went on vacation. They asked more about experience.
Interview Questions: Why do u wanna leave ur old company

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Redlands, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called for an interview within a couple of days. After the interview, I was told I would hear back from them within a week. I received a call the same day of the interview offering me the position.
Interview Questions: 1. Why Loma Linda and why this position? 2. Tell me about yourself. 3. A time where you have had disagreed with another team member. 4. What are my weaknesses? 5. What administrative software do I have experience with? 6. What project management experience do I have? 7. Why should we hire you?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview. Asked you about how you show empathy to others, what area of the hospital you'd like to work in, and your availability. You can really build off your answers off of others and try to be unique.
Interview Questions: How do you show empathy towards others? What areas of hospital to you want to work in

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Was a panel interview serious of questions with five people. The interview took about twenty minutes. Each panel asked a question and took turns. Ask questions at the end for better responses
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Great, thorough. Professional. Relevant questions, always a plus. Great organization that really cares about patients, staff, etc. Zoom as first interview, next steps in person. Vetting employees shows they really want to get the best of the best.
Interview Questions: About yourself, goals, experience, questions about position.

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews. The first one was to get the details of my background. The second was in person and they more wanted to pick my brain on how I think and solve problems.
Interview Questions: What's the draw backs to object oriented programming?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Everyone I encountered was very nice. This looks like a great place to work and everyone was very friendly. The hard part was how long it took from when I applied for the job to when I got the first call then to setting up the first interview.
Interview Questions: Why would you like this position?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Slow and if you are not SDA don’t even bother applying. It’s a very judgmental, close minded group of people who make you feel like an outsider. Find another place to work is my recommendation
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job, are you SDA, why do you want to work here, what were your daily duties in your last job

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was included meeting with dean, main manager and staff and touring the location and facility. we talked about the opportunities of living in the city, housing, expenses, etc. It was a friendly atmosphere.
Interview Questions: are you willing to relocate?

title: Hospitality Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Group interview of 5 people with only one volunteer coordinator. They interview each person one by one. Asking questions like why do you want to volunteer and why did you choose loma linda and simple ones such as your hobbies and depending on your position, they might as a scenario question.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is a recording where you only have 2 minutes to answer the questions, and you only get one try before you submit it. Then you will hear back within 1-2 weeks for a zoom interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here, and what can you contribute

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call about a week later. The call was about 15 mins and I was asked questions about my previous job and my food service knowledge.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Loma Linda Health?

title: Intake Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager and nurse, usually charge nurse. It's on site. No more than 30-45min. They ask around 10 questions. They want to know your availability as well, if you can work overtime.
Interview Questions: How to deal with a difficult situation

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Great staff, overall friendly. Straight to the point and very informative. Gave all the information about what was expected for the position. Be prepared with knowledge about hospital and the unit you desire.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. (personality question)

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was quick , straightforward
They called with options to set up dates
very kind and professional 
timeline of events was promptly followed
process/application/ website  easy to navigate
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you took someones advice or information to make a decision? what was the situation and what was the outcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward. I interviewed with the unit manager and she was very nice and outgoing. It definitely made me feel more comfortable. I was asked 4 behavioral questions and 1 clinical scenario and what I would do.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: There was a quick one question video interview before you met in person for a longer in depth meeting. The video was a lot less intimidating than the usual in person meeting straight from the beginning of the process. It lets them see if you’re a good fit before they invest more time into you as a candidate which is smart for them and good for the applicant as well.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply to LLUH and what strengths can you bring to the company?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (San Bernardino, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: convenient 2 step web based process. first, interview was a recording of interviewee answering preset questions that were reviewed by a recruiter and the second was conducted by a panel. Saved time and was completed in the comfort of my home. Panel was friendly
Interview Questions: describe a strength and weakness

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions:
Group Panel Interview. 
Basic nurse interview questions such as why did you chose nursing, and why do you want to work on the unit.  Manager and charge nurses were extremely friendly.
Interview Questions: What did you chose nursing?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Murrieta, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. easier part of getting hired. Questions regarding clinical judgement and customer service. How would you solve problems. They ask salary expectations and they ask their mission and values statement.
Interview Questions: A difficult nursing scenario. Their value statement

title: Clinical Therapist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I sat with two managers of different departments and potential discussed situations my qualifications. Interview took place over Zoom as I was in another state. The managers were friendly, for the most part.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to save a problem between you and a coworker.

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was part of a virtual job fair, that day I got a call back from the manager to arrange another interview the next day. Very positive attitudes and enthusiastic about hiring
Interview Questions: If hired, would you be able to support LLUH's Mission of "To continue the teaching and healing ministry of Jesus Christ"?

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions:
Asked the basic questions like... Why Loma Linda? Why nursing? Talk to us about a moment in which you went above and beyond for a patient and his/her family.
There were a total of 4 managers from different units and the ones that chose me called me to offer me a position within their unit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Had 3 Remote Interviews over 2 weeks. Interviewed with Finance Manager (my direct report), as well as Director.  Was a positive experience. The questions they asked were not easy, but were consistent with what was in the job description.
Interview Questions:
What hard skills I had that were relevant to the role:
SQL experience
Excel experience -  
PowerBi experience

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30 minute zoom video interview with the manager of the department. She was kind and welcoming calmed my nerves and made it feel like we were just having a chat. She asked me discuss their core values and some moments in my past where I have that interpersonal conflict and resolution and to describe a clinical situation where I was able to advocate for a patient
Interview Questions: To define their core values.

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple. I first met with the recruitment team. Second interview consisted of a tour and meeting with the VP of the corporation.  Great interview process and all my questions were answered
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself aligning with Loma Linda's mission?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of behavioral questions. I was interviewed by the department manager, it felt very casual. The time between my interview and the offer was 2 days. Having some scenarios in mind that you can use to answer behavioral questions will help.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a co-worker, and what was the outcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: 5 panel interview. Definitely came over prepared but nothing could have prepared me for this interview. Lots of situational based questions like “tell me about a time that you went above & beyond for someone, what did you do & what was the outcome. “Tell me about a time that you had to bend the rules.” “What are your strengths & weaknesses?” “Why should we hire you?” Just be yourself & confident in your abilities.
Interview Questions:
-Tell me about yourself
-Why should we hire you
-What core value represents you best
-10 situational based questions based on clinical experience

title: Emergency Services Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds in the hiring process. Interview with at least 2 people (1 nurse, sometimes in addition a current tech). with pass/fail EKG tests. There is a drug screening, physical, and lift test on a dummy.
Interview Questions:
What is one of our values that you value yourself?
What questions do you have for us?
Would you have the availability to do this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions:
Started as an online recruiting event this was not very organized. You are directed to a manager for a specific department that is interested in you, even if it's not what you applied for. It was confusing because when I asked for the department I applied for I was placed in a 'breakout room' and then dismissed. 
Fortunately I got a call back for an in person interview. It went well 50/50 clinical and personal questions
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone calls c/o chest pain? Pt is diaphoretic and SOB

title: Registerd Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is easy. They call you for zoom interview and schedule you for the meeting. 2 managers were present during the interview and both of them were nice. The interview does not feel like it is an interview, it feel like your just talking to your friend and telling them what is your experienced.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself , how do you deal with difficult patient ?

title: Central Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview and 2nd interview with 3 manages. If you are bilingual there is a portion of the interview in which they ask you questions in Spanish to test your fluency.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient

title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Murrieta, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Th e interview process was smooth and very comfortable. The manager seemed so down to earth and answered all questions I had and more.  I was very pleased and am excited to begin working with this company.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult experience with my peers and how I handled it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: One interview with two managers followed by another interview that was a panel interview with the director and educators. Interview was almost completely situational questions based on past experiences in the hospital setting.
Interview Questions: Name a time when your skills were challenged.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Call from management setting up an interview date and time. Due to the pandemic, interview was via zoom. Email with job offer sent 1 week later. Two weeks of training with a preceptor.
Interview Questions: Which of Loma Linda's values do you associate the most with and why?

title: Phlebotomy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Mar 2021

Interview Questions: When obtaining blood, why is the order of tubes, by color, important?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: 2 managers interview me and asked me to tell them about myself., Why loma linda? Please tell me a weakness and a strength. What can you do to improve your weakness. Why do you think you are the perfect fit for this position?
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why are you a good fit

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions:
It  was organized and chill. Everyone is down to earth. They showed me around and made me feel like I am at home. 
Even though Loma Linda is a Seventh Day Adventist institution, it respects all other religion.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to Loma Linda?

title: MLA Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview process is long. You interview with 3 people (30 mins a piece) they ask you the same questions but you have to answer on a who what when where why basis. All answers must be in depth.
Interview Questions: Name a time when had to go to your supervisor about an issue what happens and why.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Since we are in the middle of the COVID-19 Pandemic, interviews are now online. It is one interview with usually 2-3 people including the charge nurse, nursing manager, and one other person.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions along with why you chose the unit for the new grad program. Leadership questions and chain of command questions were asked.

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Online Zoom-type interview b/c of COVID. General interview questions (tell me about yourself, how do you prioritize self-care, why should we hire your, etc.). Know about the unit you're hiring for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what do you know about the unit, why should we hire you.

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The administration team is very welcoming. They made me feel comfortable and really wanted to get to know to determine whether I would be a great fit for the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your job experiences

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about 3 weeks later was contacted about an interview. The interview was on zoom and lasted about 40 mins.  I was interviewed by two managers on the unit I was selected for, both were very friendly and encouraging.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview with multiple managers, educators, and charge nurses. They were all very welcoming and positive, while being honest and realistic. They asked multiple general questions about myself and my experience. They then asked situation based questions related to the position and my past work experience. Overall a good experience. They let me know their decision the beginning of the following week over the phone.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you faced a challenge at work

title: Registered Nurse (New Graduate) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Multiple behavioral questions and a few situational questions. Multiple parts to one question. Very specific in questioning. Panel interview with nurse managers, charge nurses, nurse educator.  They ask a variety of questions in regards to leadership, teamwork, and personal traits.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you showed leadership.

title: New Graduate RN Position Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Virtual Interview Sign-Up was easy to navigate and use
Interview Sign-up allow other candidates to see who was interviewing and what time they were interviewing at
Interviewers started 20 minutes late
Interview was with 3 other people (2 hiring managers, 1 nurse from floor)
Interview Questions:
Why this Unit?
Why Loma Linda?
How are you planning to get to the hospital?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a wonderful experience. Very easy going and the interviewer was extremely nice. She mad me feel welcome and at ease. It was more of an informal interview so she could really get to know me.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2020

title: Operator Interview

They also gave me an opportunity to share any additional information with them that I felt was relevant to the position.
Interview Questions: Share about a situation that was unanticipated and how you responded and handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with the standard interview questions. I felt that they already had a candidate in mind and needed to meet an interview quota. Other than that it was an okay interview.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview

title: Reasearch Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Why i was interested in research?

title: Dental Assistant I Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied and got  called in for an interview 3 weeks later. The Interview itself was 35 mins long and was conducted by 2 supervisors who took turns asking questions about my personality and how I see myself.
Interview Questions: If you were an animal, what kind of animal would you be and why?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick, about 20 minutes, and the directors interviewing me were friendly. They asked the typical questions like: why do you want to work on this unit? Think of a time you had a difficult coworker/patient and how did you handle it? How do you deal with stress?
Interview Questions: What is a situation where you had to make a fast decision?

Didn't know there was supposed to be a 3rd person until they asked they I come in and interview a second time. Overall the questions were typical interview questions. Tell me a time when?.... Besides the punctuality the interview was good.
Interview Questions: Which of our values would you say you identify with closely?

title: Clinical Nurse B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: 3 person interview. One-on-one. Interviewed first with charge nurse, unit manager then sister unit manager. Scenario based questions. Focusing on safety not so much on unit specific. Very easy process. Same day offer.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions fairly easy safety & teamwork based questions

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very clear, started with the hiring manager then referred to physicians interview. Then I did shadowing for three days with previous coordinator.the background check took more than a month and medical checkup was done meanwhile.

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Testing was required and then they make you wait for an interview.  I've worked for this institution for over 25 years and they were a good company to work for until recently.
Interview Questions: Where do you attend church?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Demonstrate a good attitude during the interview and with a little bit experience, you may be hired. You must demonstrate experience in orthopedics, robotic assisted surgery, neuro surgery, and vascular
Interview Questions: Have you encountered an angry surgeon and how did you deal with the situation

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was straight forward, two interviews one over the phone and one in person. Eventually an offer was presented but I decided against moving forward and taking the position.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in marketing

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied 2-3 weeks prior to being called for an interview. I was interviewed by a set of 3 individuals, though there was supposed to be a 4th that was unable to be there at the time. We sat in a conference room. The three and I discussed my work history while going over the details of my resume. The interviewers were very friendly and it was quite a relaxed experience.  Exactly one week after the interview, I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What was one of the hardest things about your previous job?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a two-step process. The staff was amiable and everyone was very cooperative. It was under an hour long and they gave you enough time to ask questions. I got to meet different parts of every department.
Interview Questions: What do you love about serving others?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about 2 weeks later I was called and asked to come in for an interview. The interview was with my immediate supervisor and the head of the Department. They were both really nice and made me feel comfortable.  They basically just went over the job position with me. It lasted about 30 minutes. I got a call about 2 hours after I left offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Do I feel comfortable with the responsibilities of the job position.

title: Ophthalmic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their health source application. Received a phone call a few days after applying (less than 5 days), no email regarding my application status just a phone call to schedule interview. Interviewers seemed very uninterested. I felt like I was interviewing for a position that may have already chosen another candidate. Nonetheless, the interview still helped me reflect on my interviewing skills which helped me land a position at another hospital.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses. Why ophthalmology.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not too many clinical questions, most are character based and they will ask for work (healthcare work and non) related and personal experience examples. They like to hear your perspective to be well rounded and have a healthy work/personal balance
Interview Questions: How do you ensure you are adding to each team you are apart of

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the entire interview process was essentially comprised of simple conversation, basic interview questions - with the exception of anything really clinical related. The staff was very kind and approachable and also helpful.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the hiring manager and then a follow-up meeting with members of the department.  We discussed strategies for quality improvement, problem solving scenarios, and analytical methods.
Interview Questions: Describe the method for tracking and trending adverse events in the hospital

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Kind of lengthy considering there are different levels to the interview process. First level is the (unexpected) phone interview by Admin Asst. If you pass that, you will then be invited to participate in a more extensive interview. The extensive interview has a lot of possible applicants and it works on a rotation of about 5 people interviewing you. The first person you see is the Executive Director of Nutritional Services. If she doesn't feel the fit is right, that's the end of the journey for you. If she feels like you have potential, you will see the rest of the interviewers (for me 4 others). That part is over. You will receive a call if you are offered a position. You may accept/decline. If accepted, you will go through a physical.
Interview Questions: Most questions had to do with their core values

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Murrieta, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very intense interview process, can be intimidating when you interview with a panel of 5 management members. Even the one on one, then immediately another one on one with another manager is pretty intense as well. Safe to say I was super nervous lol
Interview Questions: What changed have occurred that took getting used to?

title: RN Behavioral Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Horrible lady just kept saying we need someone that will stay not leave didn't tell me anything about the job just said we need someone that won't leave and asked if I had questions had me wait due to having multiple interviews one after another
Interview Questions: Experience

title: LCSW Behavioral Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone you get a slight descrijption of the program and if you're still interested you go to interview.  There were 3 clinicians in the room asking about scenarios that could happen and how you would/have handled it.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a psychiatric client that is getting upset?

title: Financial Counselor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the manager first where she explained the job and duties to me and asked me if i would be interested I agreed . We then scheduled an interview for the next day, she was very helpful and was willing to accommodate around my current work schedule. The Interview itself was Good she was straight to the point which i really liked.
Interview Questions: Are you Comfortable with the Job Duties?

title: Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was excellent, and thorough.  they knew what they were looking for, and presented it with a pleasant experience.   open about the organizations religious practices, but did not hold it over you to conform.
Interview Questions: understanding their core values was important, and they wanted me to pick two and explain why they were important to me.

title: Welcome Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Was the typical interview process, the two people doing the interview were extremely nice. I was disappointed, however, that after 3 attempts at a follow up on the position, no on has responded to me.
Interview Questions: What did I see the Welcome Center Receptionist position doing?

title: Marketing & Events Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview about a week after application submission, an in-person Interview about two days after phone interview, submitted thank you cards a day later, followed up two weeks later and received a response to check back in a week later, followed up about 1.5 weeks later, and received an automated rejection shortly after. Overall, I enjoyed the whole process! The hiring managers were very kind and the interviews were very conversational and transparent. However, I disliked the un-personalized rejection.
Interview Questions: Situational questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called the nurse recruiter so she forwarded my application to hiring manager, got a call for a phone interview and eventually scheduled an in person interview.  Interview was standard, behavioral questions. Manager was not intimidating and was pleasant to talk to. Received a tour of the unit afterwards.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to do something under pressure.

title: Pharmacy Technician Outpatient Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was notified that my application was sent to management by recruiter through e-mail. Phone call screening. Then asked for interview. Very positive experience. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming. I was told I would be notified within one week and heard back sooner than that.
Interview Questions: How do you demonstrate some of our values?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for this position and did not hear back for almost two weeks. Then I received a call from the Human Resources that my applications ( I had applied for a few different departments) were sent to each respective department. I was told they were reviewing my application and I would hear from them next via phone calls or email. About 4-5 days after speaking with HR I got a call from one of the departments and she set me up for an interview.  Because of my current circumstances, I was scheduled for a phone interview two days later. They do phone and in-person interviews. I felt my experience was great! All the LLUMC staff was very friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: What did you do in a situation with a difficult patient and how did you handle it?

title: Clinical Nurse B Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Online application placed on file for random position (they needed one available to print during career fair processing; RSVP to RN career fair with 2 units of specified interest; interviewed with unit team including director, and 2 unit managers
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this particular unit?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: They called me and scheduled an interview. Later, I was interviewed by a panel comprised of three nurse managers. Each had a copy of my resume in front of them and they all asked me questions.
Interview Questions: How did you foresee a problem and what steps did you take to prevent that problem?

title: Clinical Nurse B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took about 5 days. I submitted my application online on Monday, was called to come in for an interview on Wednesday and had my interview on that Friday. I was called shortly after my interview and was offered the job. The whole interview was of average difficulty and lasted a little over an hour and a half. However, everyone was very sweet and easy to talk to so I didn't mind it lasting so long.
Interview Questions: Specific experience you have had that involved patient safety.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went Smoothly, average questions about work daily situations. The interviewers were very professional and I got an offer a couple days after the interview. It took me about a month from start to finish.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a X stressful situation ?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Redlands, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call about two weeks after to interview. Interview was rescheduled two times, no big deal. Finally came in for interview, went well. Was promised a decision by a specific date due to having to reschedule the initial interview. By the date given I was told the decision was not reached because they had more interviews to do--ok? I asked if I should just move on and explore other opportunities, was told no that I was a "short-list candidate". Waited another week and inquired again, was told yet again that no decision was made because they were waiting to schedule interviews. Ultimately, I decided to take an offer at another company. I felt as though I was strung along for nothing--waste of time. Very unprofessional in my option.
Interview Questions: How do you contribute to work flow

title: Cook/Baker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Four separate interviews over two days.  Many HR type questions that give you scenarios and ask what you did or would do in those situations. Had to have many stories about how you solved problems with time management, difficult co-workers and how you improved and contributed to former work places.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had many tasks and limited time to accomplish them.  Tell me about what you did and the results.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Redlands, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for multiple positions within this particular department between Friday and Sunday. Received call for interview by Wednesday. Interviewed Thursday. Offered the position on Friday. One week process. l by Three part interview process. Met with director, educator, and charge nurse. Length was approximately two hours. Everyone was kind and made you feel at home.
Interview Questions: Do you any questions for me?

title: Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was very thorough and went from early November to late January. The recruiter Aaron was simply amazing. Having been a prior Epic TS and clinical apps director he understood everything I was speaking too,  and was extremely personable. I was phone screened for 10 minutes, then the following week had a 1:1 interview for 90 minutes with the recruiter, and then invited on site for a panel interview with 2 managers, the recruiter, and the clinical apps director. I was asked to present a 5-10 minute presentation on an issue concerning the EHR field and how I would resolve it. After the recruiter let me know the timeline for decision-making and followed up exactly when he said he would.
Interview Questions: Prescreen was only 3 questions. 1:1 was when the recruiter went line by line through my resume asking me questions about previous roles and responsibilities and my final take away from each job. I really enjoyed that he did that because it shows he actually took the time to review my resume prior to us meeting. The Panel interview was just behavioural questions and a little bit of free discussion about upcoming projects and how I would have handled certain situations.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with managers and educators for RN Residency program.  Asked questions on experience, situations and desire to work at particular facility. Interview lasted around one hour and was able to ask questions to those interviewing.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult team member?

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: About two hours, it was very difficult but needed to find the right person, the interview went very well, however after the first group interview you have to have a second interview.
Interview Questions: Do you know our mission statement.

title: Patient Care Tech - FIT Team Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: 3 separate people interviewed (peer, clinical manager, hiring manager). Offer was made about 1 week later, but background and HR phase took over 3 more weeks. A couple weeks of orientation classes... Finally started working about 2 months after initial offer.
Interview Questions: Difficult situation, action, outcome. Why Loma Linda? Tell about a time when you provided spiritual care.

title: Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was very thorough, spread out over 1.5 months. Interviewers were very friendly and encouraging. To apply I filled out an online application, was phone screened by the recruiter, met 1:1 with recruiter, did a proctored online skills test, met for afternoon consisting of a 5 min presentation on any subject I would like, 2 peer panel interviews, and finally a manager panel interview. A f/u with the recruiter and then waited 2.5 weeks for a decision. There was some clarification of training details for a week and then I accepted the job.
Interview Questions: All the questions are behavioral based. Tell us about a time you did x to demonstrate how you have the values that they have as an organization. You must try to think of past experiences from your life that apply to the questions asked, then present them. It is helpful to practice telling these stories so you don&amp;#039;t get distracted and lost along the way.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (San Bernardino, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
After I applied online I was called within two weeks for an interview. Very easy & basic interview questions that took place 
1:1 with hiring supervisor. I was notified over the phone that I was selected. I was sent to HR to sign my letter of acceptance into the position. HR was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at LLUMC

title: Accelerator Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Experience/Anecdote based interview. Most if not all questions took the form of "Tell me about a time when..." They took several of us at once and had is in separate rooms, with 3 interviewers rotating between us, took around 3-4 hours or so.
Interview Questions: Have you ever experienced a time when you overcame a difficult challenge, how did you do it and how did you feel about it.

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three people panel. You and three other people will ask you interview questions. goes based on LLU core values. so you will be asked 9 questions. they will explain the job duties and task than will start the interview. they will introduce themselves than will ask you questions. everything they ask is per Human resources
Interview Questions: tell me about a time when you received unfavorable customer feed back? explain situation? how did it turn out?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fantastic. Both Manager and Director were very easy to speak with, and made me feel very comfortable. They explained the details of the job in much better detail than the posted job description defined. They were very interested in hearing details of my previous experience and explained how my experience would be complimentary to the position they were interviewing for. They were both very personable and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Explain why we should select you for this position....

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Found the position through Glassdoor, and filled out the app on their website. Took about 4 weeks for someone to call me back and schedule a phone interview. Two weeks after that I had a phone interview with the hiring manager. Then two weeks later we had an in person interview. 1-2 weeks later they offered me the position. Everyone I spoke to seemed to be really nice, and professional. It's a large organization so things take longer than you want them to due to all the processes.
Interview Questions: There weren't any technical questions, but they asked me a lot about my experience in marketing and health care. Was also asked hypothetical situations, or things that have happened in the past like "Give me an example of a time that you disagreed with your boss." They also wanted to know which of the organizational values I could relate with the most.

title: Clinical Nurse B Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Individual interviewer, three total. Focus is on values of the organization. Know the mission and values and be able to recite them to the interviewer. Other questions were pretty standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: How would you include our values into your everyday interaction with patients?

title: Foundation Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite long, but I was warned of this in advance by the hiring manager. There were multiple hoops to jump through, but most were common for the interview process. I applied on the website and then followed up with an email to a director in the hiring department. I highly suggest personalized follow up as their HR department seems to call select applicants. My process went backwards--I spoke to and impressed the hiring department who called HR to have my application expedited, which mean about 3-4 weeks before I was fully hired. I suggest an active approach with follow up and thank you notes.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. I was brought in with two other candidates and met with the following individuals (each candidate rotated through individuals; it was not a group interview:  Hiring manager and her soon-to-be new VP, a HR representative and, finally, two board members (this position worked closely with the board). I enjoyed getting to know the various individuals. All of my questions were welcomed and answered.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of an initial interview with supervisor followed something called "Care Picks" where you are interview three more times. Your are interviewed by your supervisor, a pharmacists, and last, the hiring manager for the hospital.
Interview Questions: One experience when the staff was limited and you needed to get things completed within a certain time frame

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Walk in to speak to unit manager.  Asked to return for interview.  Asked to return for second interview, then was offered a position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Transplant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was notified via email to schedule an interview. It was a 3 person interview- not a panel. I went to 3 separate rooms and spoke with 3 separate people. One from HR, the director of the department, and a peer. Each one had a set of situational questions to ask you about. Not really questions since they all started with "describe" or "tell me.."
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you resolved a conflict.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health
Interview Descriptions: Three step process with detailed questions
Interview Questions: Name a time when an idea you had failed

title: Pharmacy Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Hired after finishing tech school at UEI through the teacher who thought I would do well enough in the hospital. If you work hard and test well, you SHOULD be noticed by someone.
Interview Questions: The interview process was essentially an internship there, where I was trained and observed by middle-upper management.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took them about 4 weeks to call me for an interview. Had a face to face interview that lasted about 15 minutes. Overall nice and pleasant atmosphere, but they did not follow up like they said they would.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Child Life Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in person interview. Group panel interview with lead specialist and other Child Life Specialists. Background information with background check, drug test and education verification. Very specific Developmental questions in regards to children's developmental assessment were asked and understanding of hospitalized children and their families.
Interview Questions: Specific Questions on how to handle situations that would require Child life

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The two department managers and four technicians interviewed me in a room in the basement of the main hospital.  They each took turns asking a question or two.  It was very nice getting to know everyone and feeling as though we could all work as a team and eventually as a family.
Interview Questions: Did I have kids.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (San Bernardino, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: simple interview with a number of other candidates, it was on the spot and you had to answer questions in front of everyone. It was a good experience and very easy. I think this was a mass hiring process.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of your commitment to the mission of the agency?

title: Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions where do u see yourself in 5yrs why do you want to work for loma linda University med center. Do you handle stress well tell me about a time when u provided customer service
Interview Questions: How would u handle an angry pt

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: 2 day interview including dinner the night before and all day the next day meeting one on one with staff
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Loma Linda University Health (Loma Linda, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I worked that unit through the registry for about 8 months and after the LLUMC changed CEO's the registry wasn't used anymore so I applied directly with them and recieved an interview within a couple days as I already knew the charge nurses there. I had to pass a physical which was more rigorous than most I've taken in the past. It required a step test of one minute, lifting a 100 pound maniquen off a table and dragging it over 100 feet and back, and having someone check how much fat I had with calipers. Then I had to hold two 20 pound sand bags over the top of my head for a minute. I was sore for three days afterward, but I passed it.
Interview Questions: She didn't really ask any questions. We ended up talking about the picture of her cat and I asked if I was hired and she said yes.
